discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
The correct statements regards to partners vs. third-parties in ServiceNow's CSM application should be :

- A partner does not own the relationship with a customer. This relationship is owned by the organization they are partnering

- A partner does not own any of the products or services provided by their partnering organization, instead they help to sell, deliver and support them on their behalf

comments.content:
A third party is an organization that has been contracted to sell products and services they have actually purchased from another organization. The third-party then provides a solution that is built on top of the products and/or services purchased.


bullet
A partner does not own any of the products or services provided by their partnering organization; instead, they help to sell, deliver, and support them on their behalf.


bullet
A third party will own the relationship with the customer.


bullet
A partner does not own the relationship with a customer. This relationship is owned by the organization they are partnering.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
CE is Correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is correct with regards to partners vs. third-parties in ServiceNow’s CSM application? (Choose two.)

choices.C: A partner does not own the relationship with a customer. This relationship is owned by the organization they are partnering
choices.B: A partner and a third party are the same in ServiceNow’s CSM application
choices.E: A partner does not own any of the products or services provided by their partnering organization, instead they help to sell, deliver and support them on their behalf
choices.D: A partner is an organization that has been contracted to sell products and services they have actually purchased from another organization
choices.A: A partner will own the relationship with their customer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In ServiceNow Customer Service Management (CSM), information about a customer’s service contract is typically found in the Contract Management section, not in Knowledge.

Here’s where you can find service contract details in ServiceNow CSM:
 1. Contracts (Customer Service > Contracts) – This module stores service contracts, including their terms, start and end dates, entitlements, and associated customers or accounts.
 2. Entitlements (Customer Service > Entitlements) – Defines the services and support levels a customer is eligible for under their contract.
 3. Accounts & Contacts (Customer Service > Accounts/Contacts) – Links contracts to specific customers and their support entitlements.

The Knowledge Base (KB) is used for storing articles, troubleshooting guides, and FAQs—not contract details.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct Answer

given answer is correct. By Aakreet
check last paragraph of doc
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/create-csm-service-contracts.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCDE
Explanation: Queues can be defined based on need or type, for example, product or critical cases. You also identify the agent groups responsible for work in the queue. AWA then applies assignment rules that you set and use agent availability, capacity, skills (if defined), and shifts (if defined) to assign work to the most qualified agent. 
Source: https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-servicenow-platform/page/administer/advanced-work-assignment/concept/awa-overview.html

Selected Answer: BCDE
E-book CSM see page 125.

https://evantage.gilmoreglobal.com/reader/books/SN-CSMI-T010-PG-E/pageid/124

Selected Answer: BCDE
Answer:
 B. Skills
 C. Availability
 D. Shifts* (¯\_(ツ)_/¯)
 E. Capacity

Expanation: "Use Advanced Work Assignment (AWA) to automatically assign work items to your agents, based on their availability, capacity, and optionally, skills. AWA pushes work to qualified agents using work item queues, routing conditions, and assignment criteria that you define." note, shifts are not mentioned on that documentation

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/administer/advanced-work-assignment/concept/awa-overview.html

Selected Answer: BCDE
BCDE is Correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/administer/advanced-work-assignment/concept/awa-overview.html
